resources.string: You already have a key with alias \"%1$s\"
The alias must be at least %1$s characters long!
You already have a key with that alias!
Import by scanning a QR-Code from another phone or backup printout.
Enter your own passphrase.\nEasy to share with your friend through a phonecall, but much less secure than a secret key because somebody can guess the password!
Creates a random secret key.\nThis is the most secure key type, but needs some effort sharing it with your remote parties.
Creates a key based on a passphrase.\nThis is less secure, but you only need to agree on a passphrase, so the other party can generate a matching key.
Enter Key Alias for Imported Key
When sending encrypted messages, you will select a key by its alias.\nUsually you should enter the name of your friend you will be sharing this key with.
This is the *name* of your key, please enter at least %1$s characters
Minimum %1$s characters long, but the longer the keyphrase the more security you will get!
The shared secret phrase must be at least %1$s characters long!
Place QR-Code inside the viewfinder rectangle to scan it.
You already have this key! Your alias: \"%1$s\"
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Confirm this key by calling your friend on the phone and make sure the fingerprint below matches the fingerprint of your friends\'s key!\n%1$s
Signature could not be verified\n(Missing key)
Enter a password to protect the key
Choose a strong password. It protects your key in case your device gets stolen or confiscated!
Choose a strong password. It protects your key when sharing it with an insecure app!
Choose a strong password to generate your key from! Everybody who knows this password can recreate your key!
No key found in this image!
Enter sharing password to decrypt this key
Key successfully decrypted. Now enter an alias and save it!
Are you sure you want to share the DECRYPTED plaintext with another, possibly insecure app?
Openkeychain is required to decrypt this
Own key is invalid, please reselect!
You will not be able to\ndecrypt your own messages!
Signing key is invalid, please reselect!
Unable to encrypt, one or more keys are missing!\nDownload keys or remove recipients!
No recipient(s)! You need one or more recipients for encryption.
No key selected! Please select one or more keys first.
Not own key specified. You will not be able to decrypt yourself!
No other recipients then yourself. Are you sure?
[Upgrade OpenKeychain to resolve identity for this key!]
No password input dialogs will be shown for this text.\nTap here to re-enable!
Please enter a password to encrypt with!
The entered password can\'t decrypt this!
Encryption password is not cached anymore!
Error! Can\'t show inner data of type %1$s
No matching key found to decrypt this image.
No encrypted data found in the source image.
Something went wrong when trying to encode this image.
Couldn\'t read source image!\nNote that photos taken from within &appname; get auto-deleted a short time after taking them!
Input image too big, automatically resized to %1$d percent
You don\'t have any key yet!
The OpenKeychain app is not installed,\nplease install from …
To use PGP encryption, please install the OpenKeychain app!
Your OpenKeychain App is of version %1$s and not supported. Please update!
Configure your apps for use with &appname;.\n\nWe have preselected some apps for you, please review!
I understand that this password is weak, but I want to use it anyway!
These are your symmetric keys.\nYou don\'t need any if you use simple password or PGP encryption.
PGP encoded messages add an overhead of about 3 kilobytes or more per message. Please consider this when you have a limited data plan and possible use symmetric encryption instead!
This is the decoy content that will be shown in place of the invisible encrypted Text.

&appname; could not write the encoded text back to the underlying app!

This is most likely due the underlying app only allowing a limited number of characters in the input field!

Please try a using less recipients or use symmetric encryption, which is more compact!

The encrypted / encoded message is too long!

&appname; didn't write back the message, as otherwise the underlying app would crash!

Please try a using less recipients or use symmetric encryption, which is more compact!
Enabling &appname; as an Accessibility Service allows it to read and decrypt the screen content.

Enabling &appname; as an Accessibility Service allows it 

• to observe your actions in order to update in-place decryption, 

• to read the screen content in order to decrypt it and show it in-place, 

• to turn on enhanced web accessibility in order to allow in-place decryption in web-sites. 


Please note that &appname; does not have Internet Permission and thus there is simply no way for the screen content and other sensitive information to leave your device - YOUR PRIVACY IS GUARANTEED!

&appname; is not configured as Accessibility Service. but it need's to! 
 
&appname; needs to be enabled as an Accessibility Service so that it can read and decrypt the screen content for you: 
 
Tap "Configure" to open the settings page now, then tap "&appname;" and switch it "On".
&appname; is correctly configured as Accessibility Service.
&appname; will initially be hidden when switching to %1$s

&appname;: Encryption for all apps!

Get the &appname; app and add encryption to all Android apps.

Send eye-to-eye encrypted messages with Whatsapp, Line, SMS, Facebook, Gmail or any other app.

&dllink;
Shows encryption and signature status as icon next to every decrypted text.
En-/Disables Info Mode to display additional encryption information.
The Hide button allows you to temporarily hide the &appname; overlay.
This Button allows you to open a dialog to enter text and encrypt to the clipboard.
Decrypts or clears text in the current input field.
Show configuration page. This page can also be opened through the notification bar or by double-tapping the Hide-button.
Show a permanent notification to control &appname;.
Performs more frequent and deeper screen reading. Produces a smoother UX at the cost of increased battery use.
Include views that are deemed as "Not Important". This is needed for a few apps only. This slows down &appname; and uses more battery!.
Spread invisible characters within decoy text, rather than putting all of them at the beginning. This is needed for some apps like e.g. Instagram
Don\'t show error if no matching key
Don\'t show \"decryption failed\" overlay, when a message can not be decrypted (because there is no matching key).
Allocates more vertical space for decrypted text if it doesn\'t fit into the space used by the encrypted text. May obstruct parts of the subjacent app.
If plain text contains line breaks, put equal number of breaks into the decoy text. Warning: Leaks some information about the plaintext.
Will never automatically reuse previous encryption parameters.
Show the decrypted text right *above* an active input field, making it easier to manually review or edit the decoy text.
Add (at max) this number of random bytes before encrypting. This prevents an attacker from guessing the original message by the number of characters
&appname; is temporarily hidden for this app!
Tapping on an encrypted text will show detailed encryption info.\nWarning: This might interfere with the UX of the subjacent app!
Long-Tapping on an encrypted text will show detailed encryption info.\nWarning: This might interfere with the UX of the subjacent app!
Shows or hides the encrypt button when long-tapping on an input field.\nWarning: This might interfere with the UX of the subjacent app!
Show the encrypt button next to the active input field. (Decrypt button also won\'t show if encrypt button is not shown)
Please enter more text until the border around the input turns green!
Previous encryption parameters in use!\nTo change encryption parameters, long-tap the encryption button!
Bummer! The encrypted message has been corrupted!\nThe only way out is to start over!
Select email app to send crash report
Please help by emailing us this bug report:
Select email app to send bug report
Tap this button to temporarily hide the &appname; overlay.\n\nLong-Tap to completely exit &appname; and clear all remembered keys. (Panic-Button!)
Now tap at the same position again to bring back the &appname; overlay.
Please provide details about your problem:\n\n
Check to allow screenshots of secure content (decrypted plain text and keys)
Purge the decryption cache only on panic and screen-off. (Recommended for YubiKey users)
Enter panic mode when screen turns off
Hide launcher icon in Panic Mode
Hides the &appname; launder icon in panic mode. To reactivate &appname; after panic mode, you need to dial the secret code in the Dialer (Phone) app!
After a panic, you can reactivate &appname; by dialing this code in your dialer app.
Tap here to encrypt the text you have entered.
When a (password) input dialog is about to be shown in order to decrypt, show it immediately without asking the user first.
Please support &appname; development by upgrading to the full version.
This functionality is only available in the full version!
Please upgrade to enable the color controls below:
This is a preview of the decrypted image.\n\nPlease upgrade to enable full image decryption!
Stores only one set of encryption parameters per app. This is intended for notes keeping apps only, it should not be enabled for communication apps.
Encrypt by sharing a simple password only.\nThis is a good way to try out &appname;, but it\'s not very secure.
Encrypt with shared symmetric keys. You need to share the key with the other party!
Encrypt with PGP public/private keys. You need OpenKeychain to use this!
Tap here to encrypt and go back to your app.
Please select your own key first!

You\'re one step away from using &appname;

&appname; needs to be enabled as an Accessibility Service so that it can read and decrypt the screen content for you:
In the settings screen below, tap on \"&appname;\" and then switch it "on".

(On some phones, you need to scroll down to the end of the list to see the \"&appname;\" entry.)
Now simply start using one of your &appname; enabled apps:
Add a link to the &appname; app
"You're running plain vanilla &appname;.\nUpgrade now to enable additional features!"

Upgrading supports ongoing development and enables those additional features:

* Customize colors
* Custom decoy content
* Decrypt photos and images

Sorry, we couldn't find any supported app store for in-app billing on this phone, so unfortunately upgrading is not possible at this time.

We're working hard on supporting additional billing methods!

Please try again with an upcoming version.
Please select what suits you best:
The code should be at least %1$s digits long!
Please dial this code once to confirm!
You have a samsung phone which is known to have problem with the secret dialer code mechanism.\nYou may still give it a try but don\'t blame us if it doesn\'t work!
Hooray! The secret dialer code works.\nYou can now enable \"Hide launcher icon in panic mode\"
Please set up the Secret Dialer Code first!

&appname; currently doesn't have permission to draw over other Apps.

&appname; can not function without this permission!

Please tap on "Settings" and then allow drawing over other apps.
There is additional information for using &appname; with %1$s in the online help
Tap here to enter and encrypt a text to the clipboard
Enter text to encrypt and put into clipboard
Tap here to encrypt and put encrypted text into clipboard.
Encrypted text in Clipboard!\n\nNow long-tap on the target field and select PASTE to enter the encrypted text.
The %s app has serious issues and doesn\'t work well with &appname;.\n\nPlease check the lastest infos in our online help for more details!
Do you want to ignore this text from now on?

&appname; needs to be enabled as an Accessibility Service on your phone, but we couldn't automatically open the Android Settings "Accessibility" page.

Please manually locate and open the "Accessibility" page in your phone's settings, then locate "&appname;" and enable it.

&appname; can not function unless it's enabled as an Accessibility Service!
To get started, add one or more passwords!
Please consider making a donation to support further development of &appname;
